docs.snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry is hoping to move aside obstacles that threaten to delay the start of peace talks to end Syria's war, seeking compromise with Russia's foreign minister on which Syrian opposition groups should be eligible to participa...
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry is hoping to move aside obstacles that threaten to delay the start of peace talks to end Syria's war, seeking compromise with Russia's foreign minister on which Syrian opposition groups should be eligible to participate.

headline.main: Kerry Set to Meet Russian FM Amid Concerns Over Syria Talks

docs.snippet: The new disagreement revolves around the lingering question of who gets to represent the opposition delegation....
docs.lead_paragraph: The new disagreement revolves around the lingering question of who gets to represent the opposition delegation.
docs.abstract: Disagreement over who will represent opposition in Syrian conflict is still rampant days before world leaders convene in Geneva for peace talks; United Nations Security Council, which had proposed road map to cease-fire, moves to prioritize survival of hundreds of thousands of civilians in besieged towns.

headline.main: Dispute Over Opposition’s Seat at Table Threatens to Push Back Syria Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Dispute Over Opposition’s Seat at Table Threatens to Push Back Syria Peace Talks

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

docs.abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book The Blizzard by Vladimir Sorokin, translated by Jamey Gambrell.

headline.main: Review: In Vladimir Sorokin’s ‘The Blizzard,’ a Doctor’s Long and Strange Trip
